text:
- [Spokesperson] Thank you to
Wix for sponsoring this video.

Wix: the place to create
professional websites.

- So I like to play this
game where I come into work
and try to hide from my boss all day.
The thing is, I just don't really feel
like going to work today.
(playful upbeat music)
- Hidden In Plain Sight Number 5.

This is a show where one
of my employees, Danny,

tries to hide from me in
my own building all day,
and my goal is to put him back to work
as soon as possible.
Let's go find him.

I walk into the lobby,
ready to find Danny,

and I see a note with my
name on it on the floor.
I'm sure it's from Danny.

I'm sure it's one of his
typical red herrings.
What?

First thing I see is
his little drawing here.
Me, mad.
Yeah, mad.
Him, happy, on a roller coaster.
What?
Dear Jamie, I'm hiding again.

You seemed pretty stressed
trying to find me last time,
so I thought I'd make it more fun for you.
If you'd like me to get back to work,
you can find me in plain sight at...
Six Flags.
- [Jamie] Is this a joke?
- [Jon] No, he's actually gone.
- He's not here?
He left and he went to Six Flags?
- [Jon] He went to Six Flags.
- Six Flags is enormous, you clown!
Okay, a lot of emotions going on here.
One, I'm pissed he's not here,
because he's supposed to be here.

And at least in my mind,
when he's here, hiding,
he could possibly be doing work.
I've pulled up Six Flags on a map here.
Comparing the size of it to Vat19.
It's gigantic.

The funnel cake factory is
bigger than our building.
I'll never find him.

- First of all, do you have
a fanny pack you can put on?
- We do sell a space cat fanny pack.
- Yes!

He's going to wear the
space cat fanny pack!
- Well I guess we're going to Six Flags.
I guess I can't be that mad.
I mean it is Six Flags, but still.
The entire drive, I'm just thinking
is this a scam?

Am I going to get there
and he's not there,
and I've got to go back to Vat19

and I've just wasted, like,
an hour and a half driving.
If I run into that park,
and I'm searching that place like crazy,

and he's in the parking
lot the whole time,
I'm going to kill him.

I'm going to kill him and
then I'm going to fire him.
Yeah, this is going to sound weird,
but somebody's hiding here, from me,
and I'm looking for him.

If he was in one of those
booths or something,

and I've missed him,
I'm going to freak out.
(upbeat music)
- What is this?
- Hello.
- Danny thought you might need some help,
so told us to come out here.

- Oh you guys are going
to help me look for him.
- Not help look.
- Oh.
- Maybe help run camera, you know...

- Right, you guys just wanted
to ride the rides for free
and not work for a day, too.
Danny's a virus of not working
and it's spreading to you guys now.
What has happened?
They've lost all respect for me.

I think first things first,
I need a funnel cake.
- (laughs)
- To just, to just start finding him.
- Some finding fuel.
- So I'm going to the funnel cake.
Now I'm happy.

Going to eat this and
then we'll find Danny.
All right.
(playful music)
- It's gigantic.

Thought he might be in
costume, that's not Danny.

Is it possible that he's
riding a ride all day?

All right, I'm going to
start with that one up there.
The Ninja.
I can't tell if he's up there,
so I'm going to get a closer look.
I guess ride the ride to find out.
Let's do this.
(playful music)
(chest bar clicking)
- Okay I'm looking around.
Here it goes!
Hold on for dear life, God!
(riders screaming)

- The hat definitely came
off, but I caught it!
I caught it like a ninja!
(Jamie screaming)
- I don't see Danny anywhere!
Where are you Danny?
Woooo!

That wasn't very educational
in terms of finding Danny,
but it was fun.

So I just got a message
from Danny on my watch.
Here we go, again.
The taunting text messages from Danny.
I'm like a Ninja, you'll never find me.
It's a picture of him next to the thing.
Apparently, while Danny was looking for
his hiding spot this morning,

he had a grand old time
riding all the coasters
and everything.
This guy never works!
Look at this ride (laughs).
I better go check it out.

All right, good vantage
point, good vantage point.
Where is he?

Everything looks so
small from way up here.
Oh, there it goes!
Holy cow!
Son of a...
I saw a lot of things.
None of them were Danny.
Danny could be right there.
Right next to me, right behind me.
I'd have no idea.
Saw my heart rate probably go up to 180,
but I didn't find Danny.
So I've got to keep looking.
So I decide to check out the waterpark,
see if Danny's there.
(playful music)
Danny?

I'm going to go up here
to get a bird's eye view
of the harbor here.
Danny!
Is he just in the pool?
(sighs)
Just doing nothing all day.

It's hot out, and that
waterpark looks fantastic,

but I've got to stay
focused looking for Danny.
Lost parents.
I'm looking for a lost employee.
His name's Danny, have you seen him?

- [Employee] Is he that
guy in the blue shirt?
- Oh he's in a blue shirt?
Awesome, thank you.
- [Employee] He might be!
- He might be in a blue shirt, I love it.

Just had to ask Lost & Found,
that's all you had to do.
I guess I'll just keep walking around
and maybe I'll bump into him.
I don't know.
Oh.

- [Jon] I mean, you get a
great vantage point up there.
- That ride scares me.
I've never been on it.

I feel like I'm going
to die if I go on it.
I'm aware of the Tower of Power.
Don't want to ride it.
You see how high it goes?

My hands are getting all
clammy thinking about it.
Maybe later.
Maybe later.
Oh!
I've got to buy a poking stick.
(sticks drumming)
(playful music)
(train bell dings)
- Is he riding this train?
That guy had the right height.
He had the height.

I'm totally thinking
Danny's one of the people
up in one of those bird nest things.

See, I'm thinking Danny's
that person, right there.
(riders screaming)
(Jamie screaming)
- Just got another message from Danny.

- So you can definitely see
where I'm at from up here,

so you're going to have to
get a vantage point I think.
Good luck.
- Oh man.

I don't like heights, but
Danny sent me this message

saying that I could see him
from the Tower of Power,
so I guess I've got to ride it.
I feel like when you get to be an adult,

you have the right to
just avoid your fears.
Oh, God.
Oh, gosh, this is very high.
- [Joey] Can you see him?
- [Jamie] No, I'm not even looking.
I can't see.
I'm freaking out, this is so high.

- [Ride Operator] Okay guys,
we're going to be dropping in--
- Dude, don't
Oh, why is that dude talking?
(Joey laughs)

- [Ride Operator] Dropping
in 3, 2, 1, goodbye.
- [Jamie] No, no dude.
Oh, sh--
(Jamie screaming)

- [Ride Operator] Welcome
back down (mumbles) down here.
I mean, it's only a 230 foot drop, right?
- Oh I'm such a baby.
- [Ride Operator] We know, it's okay.
- I saw nothing, so that was useless.
I got to just take a minute.
Oh, oh, Danny sent me a message saying,

"hope you didn't lose your
voice from screaming so much"

and a picture of him
outside the Screaming Eagle.

So, either he's randomly
sending messages guessing
where I'm at, or he could see me.
So maybe he's around here.
Danny, where are you?
(riders screaming)
- Oh yeah!
(riders screaming)
(playful music)

- Has anyone seen a tall,
lanky guy that looks
like he's hiding from me?
Have you seen Danny?
I mean, the ride's called The Boss, right?
He's got to be in there.

Oh I'm hiding from my
boss at The Boss all day.

- [Ride Operator] Welcome
everyone to The Boss,

and a very special welcome to
our guest, Jamie Salvatori.

We have a special message
for you from Danny.

Jamie, enjoy your ride
on The Boss (mumbles)
I'm the boss now.
- So I sit down to ride The Boss,

and the ride operator starts
giving me a clue from Danny.

But as he is, the other train
comes in, and it's so loud,
I can't hear what the guy's saying.
And then the train takes off.
What did he say?
Gosh dang it!
What did that guy say?
I'm the boss Danny!
Oh yeah!
I need to know what he said again.
- Jamie, enjoy your time on The Boss,
because clearly I'm the boss now.

And I hope you won't
harbor any bad feelings
towards your new employer.
- Okay, so he's just teasing me.
Not helping me at all.
No clue.
He's sending me more taunting messages.

- So Jamie, the colder you
get, the warmer you'll be.

- The colder you get,
the warmer you'll be.
All right.
All right, let's see, let's see.
Where do we need to go?
Where is he?
The last message he sent me,
he was in front of this guy here.
So maybe he's nearby?

- Did you find who you
were looking for yet?
Did you find him yet?
- No.
- Okay.
- That it?
- I wish I could help you find him.
- That it, no hints?
Nothing.
(groans)

Man, I really hope I don't
poop my pants on this one.
Oh dear God.
- [Jon] Hey Jamie!
- [Jon] Don't forget to look down!
- Don't forget to look down?

Is he hiding underneath
this ride somewhere?
Oh no.
Trying to stay chill.
Stay chill.
Look cool bro.
Look cool bro.
(Jamie screaming)
(playful music)
- I'm lazy Danny!
Oh I hate you!
(Jamie screaming)
- Where did he go?!
(roller coaster whooshing)
- I'm so mad.
Huge sign that says, "I'm lazy" from Danny
as we're looking straight down.
I'm so mad.

I don't even know what
that means right now.
I don't know what that means.
I know it's true though.

Are there any rides here
that have the name 'lazy'
in it, somewhere?
Wait a second.
(gasps)

If you're going to skip work
all day, at an amusement park,
and do the least amount of work possible,
where you going to go?

I don't know why I didn't
think of it earlier.
(video rewinding)
(upbeat music)
- [Danny] I love roller coasters.
I love Six Flags.
Jamie knows this.

So what I'm going to do is
try to run out the clock

by distracting him with my
love of roller coasters.
The note that I left him had a picture

of me on a roller coaster
and him looking on angrily,
so he's going to immediately think,
"go to the roller coasters."

I even took pictures of myself
on a bunch of roller coasters
to throw him off throughout the day.

So now Jamie knows my
favorite part of a theme park
is the roller coasters,
but what he probably doesn't know

is my favorite part of a
waterpark is the lazy river.

And what better way to
spend your day not working
than to just be as lazy as possible?

So out of all the ways
I've hid from my boss,
this is by far the most out in the open.

So what I'm going to count
on is the general size
of the theme park to be my disguise.
Now I have to leave some clues for him,

because otherwise it would
be impossible and unfair.

So I've left a script for
one of the ride operators
to talk to him when he gets on the ride.

- And I hope you won't
harbor any bad feelings
towards your new employer.
- [Danny] I had a caricature artist draw
a picture of me in my hiding spot.

And I left a gigantic
sign on the bottom of
one of the rides that he'll be able to see
for just a second.
- [Jamie Voiceover] I'm lazy?!

- So while I have to sit
still, I'm not moving.

It just happens to be that
this river's taking me around
the waterpark.

- He's probably in the
waterpark, just sitting there.

I think I found him with
less than an hour to spare.
I don't know why in my mind this is worse
than hiding out there.

You're just sitting in
a waterpark all day?
I smell so bad.

So when I find him, I'm
just going to give him

a big old bear hug and
let him just (sniffs)
take it in.
Here it is.
It all makes sense now.
The I'm lazy sign, the lazy river.
Ridiculous.
Just drinking your little drink all day.
I worked hard today

and he's been sitting
in a lazy river all day?
I hope you get a sunburn.
- You could find me.

I wasn't even hiding this time,
I was just floating around.
- You were hiding in an amusement park
that was gigantic.
- You're welcome.
- Everyone else worked, but you.

I'm going to give you
a big hug, take it in,
sniff it in.
Oh, I smell good.
Right, sniff that in.

I still don't even know who
paid for this whole thing.
- Good question.
(playful music)
- I want to talk to you about Wix.

Over 140 million people
use Wix for their website.
You can start and publish for free,

and choose from over
500 stunning templates
or start from scratch.
Oh, God I hate this.
Why aren't these shades thicker?

You can change, customize,
or add anything you want.
Oh, God.

I mean we used it to
make this awesome website
about our day at Six Flags.

You know, hiding from
Jamie, going on rides,
hiding from Jamie.
All sites include built-in SEO tools
to help your website get found.
Everything is automatically optimized
for any device and it's got the tools
to create the website that you want.

You can use the Wix
Editor and build a website
using just drag and drop,
or use the artificial design intelligence

to create a stunning
website for you in minutes.
Check out Wix.

And thanks again to Wix
for sponsoring this video.
I hate you!
I'm done.
You did well.

I was getting a little
worried by the end of the day.
- Oh I did well?
Okay.
Literally, what were you doing all day?
- There were daiquiris.
I met some nice people.
Took a--
- Daiquiris, plural?
- No com--
- Multiple daiquiris?
- No comment.
I took a nap.
- You took a nap?!
- And just general relaxing.

Making sure I got the
most out of my time off.
- Unbelievable (laughs).
I don't know what to say, y'all.
I did have a really good time.
And in fact, Six Flags wants all of you
to have a good time,

which is why they're giving
away 20 season passes.

- Yeah, all you have to do
is go ahead and follow us
on Instagram @vat19crew
and we'll give you all the details there.
- Yeah, do it.
♪ Vat19.com ♪
